lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: A frail-looking young man with pale skin and dark circles under his eyes was sitting on a rusty bench across from the police station.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: He was cradling a cup of coffee in his hands — not the cheap synthetic type slum rats like him had access to, but the real deal.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: This cup of plant-based coffee, usually available only to higher rank citizens, had cost most of his savings.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: But on this particular day, Sunny decided to pamper himself.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: After all, his life was coming to an end.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Enjoying the warmth of the luxurious drink, he raised the cup and savored the aroma.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Then, tentatively, he took a small sip… and immediately grimaced.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: Ah! So bitter!

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Giving the cup of coffee an intense look, Sunny sighed and forced himself to drink some more.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: I should have bought a piece of real meat instead. Who knew actual coffee is so disgusting? Well. It's going to keep me awake, at least.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: He stared into the distance, dozing off, and then slapped himself in the face to wake up.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: Tsk. What a rip-off.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Shaking his head and cursing, Sunny finished the coffee and stood up.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Rich people living in this part of the city were rushing past the small park on their way to work, staring at him with strange expressions.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Looking haggard in his cheap clothes and from the lack of sleep, unhealthily thin and pale, Sunny was indeed out of his place here.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Also, everyone seemed so tall.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Watching them with a bit of envy, he tossed the cup into a garbage bin.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: I guess that's what three full meals a day would do to you.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The cup missed the bin by a wide margin and fell on the ground.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny rolled his eyes in exasperation, walked over and picked it up before carefully putting it in the trash.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Then, with a slight grin, he crossed the street and entered the police station.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Inside, a tired-looking officer gave him a quick glance and frowned with obvious distaste.

lines.speaker: Officer
lines.text: Are you lost, boy?

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny looked around with curiosity, noting reinforced armor plates on the walls and poorly hidden turret nests in the ceiling.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The officer, too, looked scruffy and mean.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: At least police stations remained the same wherever you go.

lines.speaker: Officer
lines.text: Hey! I'm talking to you!

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: Uh, no.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Then he scratched the back of his head and added:

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: As demanded by the Third Special Directive, I am here to surrender myself as a carrier of the Nightmare Spell.

lines.speaker: Officer
lines.text: Are you sure you are infected? When did you start showing symptoms?

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: A week ago?

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The officer became visibly paler.

lines.speaker: Officer
lines.text: Shit.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Then, with a hurried motion, he pressed a button on his terminal and bellowed:

lines.speaker: Officer
lines.text: Attention! Code Black in the lobby! I repeat! CODE BLACK!

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The Nightmare Spell first appeared in the world a few decades ago.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Back then, the planet was just starting to recover from a series of devastating natural disasters and subsequent resource wars.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: At first, the emergence of a new disease that caused millions of people to complain about constant fatigue and sleepiness did not attract a lot of attention.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: But when they started to fall into an unnatural slumber, with no sign of waking up even days later, governments finally panicked.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Of course, by then it was already too late — not that an early response could have made any difference.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: When the infected started dying in their sleep, their dead bodies turning into monsters, no one was ready.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Nightmare Creatures quickly overwhelmed national militaries, plunging the world into complete chaos.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: No one knew what the Spell was, what powers it possessed, and how to fight it.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: In the end, it was the Awakened — those who survived the first trials of the Spell and came back alive — who put a stop to its rampage.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Armed with miraculous abilities earned in their Nightmares, they restored peace and created a semblance of a new order.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Of course, it was only the first of the catastrophes brought upon by the Spell.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: But as far as Sunny was concerned, none of it had anything to do with him — not until a few days ago, that is, when he first started having trouble with staying awake.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: For an average person, being chosen by the Spell was as much of a risk as an opportunity.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Kids learned survival skills and fighting techniques in school, on the off chance of being infected.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Well-to-do families hired private tutors to train their children in all sorts of martial arts.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Those from the Awakened clans even had access to powerful legacies, wielding inherited Memories and Echoes in their first visit to the Dream Realm.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The richer your family was, the better your chances of surviving and becoming an Awakened were.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: But for Sunny, who had no family to speak of and spent most of his time scrounging for food instead of going to school, being chosen by the Spell presented no opportunity at all.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: To him, it was basically a death sentence.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: A few minutes later, Sunny was yawning while several policemen were busy putting him in restraints.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Soon he was fastened into a bulky chair that looked like a weird mix between a hospital bed and a torture device.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The room they were in was situated in the basement of the police station, with thick armored walls and a formidable-looking vault door.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Other officers were standing near the walls, with automatic rifles in their hands and grim expressions on their faces.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny did not particularly care about them.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The only thing he could think about was how much he wanted to sleep.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Finally, the vault door opened, and a gray-haired policeman walked in.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: He had a seasoned face and stern eyes, looking like someone who had seen a lot of terrible things in his life.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: After checking the restraints, the policeman glanced quickly on his wristwatch and then turned to Sunny:

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: What's your name, kid?

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: Sunless.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The old policeman raised an eyebrow.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Sunless? That's a strange name.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: What's so strange about it? At least I have a name. Back in the outskirts, not everyone even gets one.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: It's because I was born during a solar eclipse. My mom had a poetic soul, you see.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: That's why he got this weird-ass name and his little sister was called Rain… back when she still lived with them, at least.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Whether it was the result of poetic imagination or simple laziness, he did not know.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The old policeman grunted.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Do you want me to contact your family?

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: There's no one. Don't bother.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: For a second, there was a dark look on the policeman's face.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Then his expression turned serious.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Alright, Sunless. How long can you stay awake?

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: Uh… not long.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The policeman sighed.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Then we don't have time for the full procedure. Try to resist for as long as you can and listen to me very carefully. Okay?

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Not waiting for a response, he added:

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: How much do you know about the Nightmare Spell?

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: As much as anyone, I guess? Who doesn't know about the Spell?

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Not the fancy stuff you see in dramas and hear in the propaganda broadcasts. I mean how much do you really know?

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: That was a hard question to answer.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: Don't I just go into the Dream Realm, kill a few monsters to complete the First Nightmare, receive magic powers and become an Awakened?

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Listen carefully. Once you fall asleep, you will be transported inside your First Nightmare.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Nightmares are trials created by the Spell.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Once inside, you will meet monsters, sure, but you will also meet people.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Remember: they are not real. They're just illusions conjured up to test you.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: How do you know?

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: I mean, no one understands what the Spell is and how it works, right? So how do you know that they're not real?

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: You might have to kill them, kid. So do yourself a favor and just think about them as illusions.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: A lot of things about the First Nightmare depend on luck.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Generally, it shouldn't be overwhelmingly hard.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: The situation you're in, the tools you have at your disposal and the creatures you have to defeat should be within the range of your abilities, at least.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: After all, the Spell sets up trials, not executions.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: You're a bit disadvantaged due to… well… your circumstances.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: But kids from the outskirts are tough. Don't give up on yourself just yet.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny was getting more and more sleepy.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: It was becoming hard to follow the conversation.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: About those "magic powers" you mentioned… you will indeed receive them if you survive until the end of the Nightmare.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: What those powers will be, exactly, depends on your natural affinity as well what you do during the trial.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: But some of it will be at your disposal right from the start…

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The voice of the old policeman sounded more and more distant.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny's eyelids were so heavy that he was struggling to keep his eyes open.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Remember: the first thing you must do once inside the Nightmare is to check your Attributes and your Aspect.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: If you get a combat-oriented Aspect, something like a Swordsman or an Archer, things will be easier.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: If it is reinforced by a physical Attribute, then that's even better.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Combat Aspects are the most common, so the probability of receiving one is high.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The armored room was growing dimmer.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: If you're unlucky and your Aspect has nothing to do with combat, don't despair.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Sorcery and utility Aspects are useful in their own ways, you'll just have to be smart about it.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: There are really no useless Aspects. Well, almost.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: So just do anything in your power to survive.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: If you survive, you will be halfway to becoming an Awakened.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: But if you die, you'll open a gate for a Nightmare Creature to appear in the real world.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Which means that my colleagues and I will have to deal with it.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: So… please don't die, Sunless.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Already half-asleep, Sunny felt a bit touched by the policeman's words.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: Or, at least, try to not die right away.

lines.speaker: Old Policeman
lines.text: The nearest Awakened won't be able to get here for a few hours, so we would really appreciate it if you don't make us fight that thing ourselves…

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: 'What?'

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: With that last thought, Sunny finally slipped into a deep slumber.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Everything became black.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: And then, in the darkness, a faintly familiar voice rang:

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: [Aspirant! Welcome to the Nightmare Spell. Prepare for your First Trial…]
